result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Katie Ann Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katie Ann Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katie Ann Thomas was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Katie Ann Thomas was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Court costs of $243.00 and DNA Analysis Surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in counts 2 & 3 in case # 14CF28.

records.addlTxt: Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Katie Ann Thomas appeared. Case called at 8:18. Includes 15CF238, 14CF28. ADA Minser updates the court, there is a resolution in 15CF238. Atty. Smestad agrees. ADA Minser requests to dismiss with prejudice. Court dismisses with prejudice 15CF238. Court modifies paragraph 3 to 3 years 6 months and to include paragraph 12 as to DE to complete MRT. records.addlTxt: Assessment Report. c: Probation. mw

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Amber Hahn, DF ATTY: Joel D. Schlitz, DF: Katie Ann Thomas appeared. Includes case no. 14CF28 and 14CM008.  DE files a Plea Questionaire Waiver of Rights with the Court.   There is a deferred agreement in count 1. DE pleads Guilty to Cts 1, 2, and 3 in 14CF28.  Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1, 2 and 3 in 14CF28.  Court withholds entry of judgment in Count 1 of 14CF28 in favor of Deferred Agreement.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 4 and 5 in 14CF28 and Court dismisses case 14CM008. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

14CF28:
- Deferred agreement on Count 1.
- S/W  2 years probation with conditions in Counts 2 and 3.

Conditions of probation.
- Court costs of $443.00 on counts 2 and 3 payable through the DOC.
- Follow recommendations of agent.

Report to probation today by 3:00 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
